sen.e: (The articles to be exported should be piled up in row on the streets, the people living along the roads used by Japanese to visit the capital, no matter whether they are public servants or ordinary citizens, are pulled out to carry the traded goods, his wife and children also have to render their services, while cows that can not bear heavy burdens, collapse by the roadside.)

sen.e: Products to be exported are piled up on the streets, and all residents who live along the streets which Japanese people use for the travel to the capital city, both government officials and ordinary people, have to help the transportation of the products day and night; and furthermore, even women and children also have to do that duty, and cows which sink under a heavy burden just fall down on the street.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 朝鮮王朝実録には、恒居倭同士の殺人事件に関し朝鮮王朝が関与を放棄した事例や、宗氏の派遣した代官が検断権を握っていたことなどが記録されており、朝鮮王朝は恒居倭に対する検断権を放棄していたと考えられている。
sen.e: "Korea Dynasties Fact Record" reported a murder case among the Japanese permanent residents, in which the Korean Dynasties gave up its commitment and the fact that the local governor dispatched from the So clan was executing the right to judge criminal cases, and considereing these discriptions, it is supposed that the Korean Dynasties had given up the right to judge criminal cases of the Japanese permanent residents.

"Korea Dynasties Fact Record" reported a murder case among permanent Japanese residents, in which the Korean Dynasties gave up their commitment to the case, and the fact that the local governor dispatched from the So clan was executing the right to judge criminal cases, it is supposed that the Korean Dynasties had given up the right to judge criminal cases among permanent Japanese residents.

As of 1429, the Soda clan was held the power to levy taxes over permanent Japanese residents.

sen.j: また、朝鮮王朝は恒居倭に対し営業税の課税を検討したが、既に早田氏が課税しているため実行は困難と判断し中止している。
sen.e: The Korean Dynasties also studied the viability to impose a business tax to the Japanese permanent residents, but the dynasties considered it difficult to carry out and gave up the imposition, because the Soda clan had already taxed them.

The Korean Dynasties also studied the viability to impose a business tax on permanent Japanese residents, but the dynasties considered it difficult to carry out and gave up, due to the fact that the Soda clan had already taxed them.

sen.j: これらは、朝鮮王朝が徴税権を行使出来なかったこと、1429年の時点で恒居倭は宗氏ではなく早田氏が掌握していたことを示している。
sen.e: This anecdote reveals that the Korean Dynasties were not able to execute their power to levy taxes, and the Japanese permanent residents as of 1429 were controlled by the Soda clan and not by the So clan.

This anecdote reveals that the Korean Dynasties were unable to execute their power to levy taxes, and the permanent Japanese residents as of 1429 were controlled by the Soda clan and not by the So clan.

sen.j: 1477年、朝鮮王朝は恒居倭へ田租の課税を検討するが、倭寇の再発を憂慮し中止している。

In 1488, the Korean Dynasties planned to introduce Denso (rice field tax) but abandoned the plan, being afraid of the reemergence of Wako.

sen.j: またその際、恒居倭の免税特権を悪用した朝鮮人の納税回避の危険性が指摘されるが、後にその危惧は現実の物となる。

sen.j: 宗氏と朝鮮王朝の間では孤草島釣魚禁約をもって朝鮮沿岸における日本人の漁場が制限されていた。

Illegal trade was habitually practiced and the collusion between permanent Japanese residents and Korean residents accelerated.
